isis.stitle: FE 300 BUS BODY COMPONENTS - Description - Bus Body - Exterior

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Entry Door
svcsubproc.para: The passenger side entry doors are aluminum structured door assemblies utilizing increased height and through door visibility with larger functional glass areas. The door are electrically operated by the driver switch located in the steering wheel control panels. An emergency override switch is located on the overhead panel above the entry door. The passenger door assembly is also available as an air activated assembly. The air actuated override switch is located on the driver right wing panel.

note.para: The electric operated door opener has no speed adjustment control but limit switches can adjust the door opening limits.
The air operated passenger door opening speed may be adjusted to allow for open and closing cycle times. The door mechanism is located above the entry door header and has a manual override.

svcsubproc.title: Vandal Lock
svcsubproc.para: The Vandal Lock option allows the driver to close and lock the passenger side entry door when the school bus is parked and not in operation or is intended to restrict access to the bus without the driver being present. The vandal lock is located on the passenger side of the bus forward of the side entry door above the cross view mirror mounting assembly and below the passenger side wing panel window.

calloutgroup.callout1: PASSENGER SIDE FRONT WING PANEL WINDOW
PASSENGER SIDE CROSS VIEW MIRROR MOUNTING ARM

svcsubproc.title: D.O.T. Lights And Reflectors
svcsubproc.para: Federally mandated reflectors and clearance lights are located according to F.M.V.S.S. standards. The reflectors, depending on location, may be red or amber in color.

figure.caption: Figure 19. D.O.T. Lights (Side mounted on body)

svcsubproc.title: Assist Steps
svcsubproc.para: Assist steps are located each side of the bumper assembly below the crossing gate arm. These are furnished to assist in accessing the windshield or wipers for cleaning, servicing or adjustment. Grab handles ( Figure 20, Item 4) are also installed each side of the bus exterior to assist in accessing the windshield area and wiper assemblies.

svcsubproc.title: Fuel Fill
svcsubproc.para: The FE series bus fuel fill assembly is located on the passenger side of the bus body. The fuel fill may be located at the forward section passenger side of the bus ( Figure 21, Item 1), aft of the front wheel well opening on buses equipped with side frame rail mounted fuel tanks. The fuel tank and fuel fill may be located on the driver side of the bus. Access to the fuel filler assembly may require a key if fuel fill door is of the locking type. Buses with fuel tanks located aft of the rear axle and between the frame rails have the fuel fill located on the passenger side of the body behind the rear wheel well openings. A spring hinged fuel fill door with or without lock or latching mechanisms are utilized on the fuel fill access doors.

figure.caption: Figure 21. Fuel Fill Door (Bus With Frame Rail Mounted Fuel Tank Shown)

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Doors
svcsubproc.para: The FE Series school bus is equipped with emergency escape exits as required by state and federal law. The school bus must be equipped with one emergency escape door located at the rear ( Figure 22) or mid ship section of the school bus, depending on the number of occupants and/or state requirements. The school bus is also equipped with emergency escape push-out or kick-out windows; location and number are per requirement of state or local mandates. Roof mounted escape hatches may also be provided for bus egress in a roll-over situation. The FE school bus is equipped with recessed hidden hinge assemblies at the rear and side emergency doors. All emergency exits are equipped with an open door alarm activation switch to alert the driver of any emergency door which might be ajar.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Emergency Exit Door (Rear Door Exit Shown)

svcsubproc.title: Emergency Exit Windows
svcsubproc.para: Emergency exit push-out or kick-out windows ( Figure 23, Item 2) are located each side of the bus as required by individual state requirements. The number and location of the emergency escape windows is subject to the state or local mandates. Emergency escape windows may come in different configurations as required by the state requirements. The windows may latch and kick-out with a bottom mounted latch or swing out vertically with a vertically mounted latch. All emergency windows are equipped with a relay alarm switch that activates when the latch mechanism is opened. This will alert the driver of any open emergency windows.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Emergency Exit, Bottom Push-Out Windows Shown (Exterior View)

calloutgroup.callout1: KICK-OUT WINDOW WITH LOCKING INTERIOR LATCH (AT WINDOW INTERIOR)

svcsubproc.title: Passenger Windows
svcsubproc.para: The FE Series school buses are equipped with aluminum extruded framed passenger windows. All windows are top opening with dual closure latches at the top of the upper window frame assembly. The bus passenger windows are removable for glass replacement and/or other repairs.

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Emergency Escape Hatch
svcsubproc.para: The roof mounted escape hatch allows egress from the bus body through the roof section in the event of an emergency where exiting the emergency exit doors or windows are not possible ( Figure 25, Item 3).

svcsubproc.title: Rear Bumper Assembly
svcsubproc.para: The rear bumper assembly is a full wrap around style bumper bolted to the chassis frame assembly. The optional tow hooks are also mounted to the frame assembly and are located below the bumper assembly ( Figure 26, Item 4) at the rear of the bus.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Rear Bumper Assembly and Tow Hooks

svcsubproc.title: Rear Body Exterior Lights
svcsubproc.para: The lower rear body lights include all requirements of F.M.V.S.S. with options that may be required by the local state or regional authority.

calloutgroup.callout1: CLEAR BACK-UP LIGHTS (SIZES OF LIGHT ARE OPTIONAL)

svcsubproc.title: Side Traffic Stop Arms
svcsubproc.para: Driver side stop arm signs are located at the forward portion of the bus body under the driver side window. These signs are electrically or air operated with flashing warning lights facing forward with a large reflective stop sign. The warning lights on the safety arm may vary in the type of lights required by the local district or state standard. An optional air operated safety arm is available.

figure.caption: Figure 28. Standard Stop Sign and Light

calloutgroup.callout1: RED FLASHING WARNING LIGHTS (LIGHT TYPE MAY VARY)

figure.caption: Figure 29. Optional L.E.D. Side Stop Sign

calloutgroup.callout1: STOP ARM REFLECTIVE STOP SIGN FACE

svcsubproc.para: An optional rear stop arm may be specified ( Figure 30). This stop arm is located on the rear street side of the bus body with the warning light and sign face facing the rear of the bus when activated.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Side Rear Stop Sign and Light

STOP ARM ASSEMBLY FRONT MOUNTING BOLTS

svcsubproc.title: Under Body Compartments
svcsubproc.para: Additional compartments under the bus body are available on either side of the bus, depending on the size and location of the fuel tank. These compartments vary in size and type of door hardware. Compartments may be equipped with horizontal hinges or vertical depending on the style and size compartment chosen.

calloutgroup.callout1: UNDER BODY FACE SKIN ASSEMBLY MOUNTING HOLES AND SCREWS

svcsubproc.title: Electrical Compartment
svcsubproc.para: The body electrical compartment on the FE bus is located on the driver side directly below the driver side window. This compartment encapsulates all the bus body electrical functions. The body main electrical relays, fuse panels and harness connections are located in this compartment. Located on the inside of the enclosure door is the location schematic for all relays and fuse types and sizes.

svcsubproc.title: Windshield Washer Fluid Reservoir
svcsubproc.para: The windshield wiper washer fluid reservoir is located below the driver window and chassis / bus electrical compartment.

svcsubproc.title: Battery Compartment
svcsubproc.para: The bus battery compartment is located directly behind the driver side front wheel opening ( Figure 6, Item 8). The compartment is equipped with a slide out type tray ( Figure 35, Item 5) with locking tray latch ( Figure 35, Item 6). The battery compartment is secured by a positive latching device that may incorporate a key locking feature.

calloutgroup.callout1: BATTERY COMPARTMENT FACE PLATE MOUNTING SCREWS

svcsubproc.title: Radio Antenna
svcsubproc.para: The bus may be equipped with an optional AM/FM entertainment radio. The radio would be located in the driver's right hand wing panel. The entertainment radio antenna ( Figure 36, Item 1) is located on the driver side vertical pillar directly to the rear of the driver side window.

calloutgroup.callout1: ENTERTAINMENT RADIO ANTENNA (IF ENTERTAINMENT RADIO EQUIPPED)

svcsubproc.title: Chair Lift Door And Chair Lift
svcsubproc.para: Optional handicapped access requirements are an available option. The wheelchair lift is available in different configurations. Depending on the district requirements the chair lift may be located at the rear of the bus, at mid-point or directly behind the front wheel well opening.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Chair Lift Door (Shown At Rear With Forward Exterior Hinge Assembly)

svcsubproc.para: The chair lift option is available from different manufacturers as may be requested by the customer. The chair lift assembly is mounted directly inside the body by the chair lift door. The entire mechanism, depending on manufacturer, is either all electric control or hydraulically controlled. The chair lift door latching mechanism is equipped with a door open sensor which activates when the handle is opened, and alerts the driver the door is ajar ( Figure 86, Item 4). Depending on the location, the door may swing left or right. The chair lift operating functions are detailed in the chair lift operators manual if the bus is so equipped.

figure.caption: Figure 38. Chair Lift Assembly and Door Opening

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted Strobe Light (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The roof warning light is located on the center section of the roof structure or as may required by the state or local governing authority. The light is available ( Figure 39) in different types and styles. These lights are generally in use during times when students are in transit on the bus.

figure.caption: Figure 39. Optional Roof Strobe Warning Light

svcsubproc.title: End Caps
svcsubproc.para: The end caps are located at the top of the bus body both forward and aft. The front end cap is located directly above the windshield assembly. The front end cap assembly houses the school bus identification or destination sign, the upper front amber warning lights, the red "stop" warning lights, and the required F.M.V.S.S. clearance lights and forward side marker lights. The bulbs that illuminate this option can be accessed from inside the bus. The rear bus end cap is located at the rear of the bus over the rear windows and emergency exit door. The rear end cap is similar in design and function, except that the clearance lights and upper body side marker lights are red instead of amber in color. The location of the warning lights or type of warning light may vary based on the state or local jurisdiction requirements.

calloutgroup.callout1: RED "STOP" WARNING LIGHTS ( LOCATION MAY VARY WITH OR WITHOUT AMBER WARNING LIGHT)

svcsubproc.title: Windshield - 4 Piece
svcsubproc.para: The FE bus incorporates a four piece windshield design. The two center panels ( Figure 41, Item 2) allow for full frontal view. The side panels ( Figure 41, Item 3) allow for better peripheral vision and rear view mirror visibility. The windshield perimeter is encapsulated in a single piece rubber type windshield mounting seal. The center windshield section may be removed and replaced without removing the side panels.

calloutgroup.callout1: LEFT AND RIGHT SIDE WINDSHIELD PANELS

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Sliding Window
svcsubproc.para: The driver side sliding window is an aluminum extruded sliding window assembly with a positive latching device to secure the window in a closed position. The forward section of the window slides full length aft when the rear window is in closed position. The rear window slides full length forward, when front section is closed. The window is equipped with a positive latching device to secure the window in a closed locked position.

svcsubproc.title: Driver Side Sliding Storm Window (Optional)
svcsubproc.para: The driver side sliding window is also supplied with a sliding storm window option. The window is designed for use in colder climates and eliminates frost build up on the window in adverse weather. The window glass is a heavier and thicker design. This sliding window assembly utilizes a thicker thermal type glass mounted in an aluminum extrusion. The window is mounted in the window frame area but has an offset extruded framework to compensate for the glass thickness.

svcsubproc.title: Static Roof Vents
svcsubproc.para: Static roof vents are standard on the FE school bus. The static vents are located at the low pressure point on the roof. Optional roof hatches may be equipped with static vents.

svcsubproc.title: Mud Guards
svcsubproc.para: Mud Guards front and rear are optional equipment.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Wheel Rubber Fenderettes
svcsubproc.para: Rear wheel opening rubber fenderettes are an available option on the FE school bus. The fenderettes reduce wheel splash and help minimize body damage.

svcsubproc.title: Body Tie Down Bolts And Assemblies
svcsubproc.para: The body tie down bolts are mechanical fasteners that secure the body floor panels to the chassis frame rail. This application consists of a combination of body tie down clips and 1/2 inch - 13 x 11 1/2 inch bolts and nuts equipped with j-bars that fit around the chassis frame rail. A high durometer anti-squeak rubber is located between the bus body floor and the chassis frame rail. The anti-squeak function is to absorb and dampen sound and vibration. Anti-squeak should be in place before the tie down bolts are torqued.

The body tie down bolts should be tightened within 30 days or 1,000- 2,000 miles and quarterly thereafter. The tie down bolts should be torqued 35 to 40 Lbf-ft. (47.5-54 Nm). The body tie down bolts, front outrigger mounting bolts, shear bolts and standard tie downs should be part of a normal preventative maintenance check.
